name: things worn to cover head face and neck

children.name: hat
children.definition: a piece of clothing that you wear on your head : mũ
examples: Maria was wearing a beautiful new hat.
straw/cowboy/bowler etc hat
in a hat
a man in a fur hat
cowboy hata hat with a wide, curving lower edge, especially worn by cowboys: nón cao bồi
top hat(informaltopper) a tall black or grey hat worn by men on some formal occasions :mũ chóp cao
sun hata hat to protect your head from the sunmũche nắng
hard hata hat made of a strong substance which is worn by builders and other workers to protect their head:mũ bảo hộ lao động
bowler hat(alsobowler, US alsoderby) a man's hat that is black and has a round hard top mũ quả dưa
tin hatinformal a metal hat worn by soldiers to protect their heads :mũ sắt của binh sĩ
-hattedsuffix describes a person wearing a particular type of hats
bowler-hattedđộimũ quả dưa
The bowler-hatted British businessman is not a common sight anymore.
bowler-hatted/ top-hatted etc(= wearing a bowler hat, top hat etc )
a bowler-hatted gentleman

children.name: visor
children.definition: a curved piece of plastic that you wear on your head so that it sticks out above your eyes and protects them from the sun : mũ lưỡi trai chống nắng
examples: a sun visor

children.name: cap
children.definition: A2a type of flat hat that has a curved part sticking out at the front, and is often worn as part of a uniform : mữ lưỡi trai
examples: old men in flat caps
a chauffeur’s peaked cap
a baseball cap(= that people wear for baseball and for fashion )He was wearing a sweater and a baseball cap.
a flat cap(alsoa cloth cap)UK(= made of cloth with a stiff piece that sticks out at the front )We saw an old man in a jacket and a brown flat cap.
a peaked cap(=worn as part of a uniform)She wore a sailor's peaked cap.
stocking cap[ C ]USa close-fitting knitted hat with a long tail:nón len; mũ len
wear a capHe was wearing a baseball cap.
put on/take off/remove your capHe opened the door, took off his cap, and threw it on a hook.
cap[C] a covering that fits very closely to your head :
a swimming/bathing capA swimming cap will stop you getting your hair wet.
a shower cap(= worn to keep your hair dry when having a shower )There was a little bag containing soap, shampoo and a shower cap.
cap[C] a type of simple hat that fits very closely to your head, worn especially by women in the past :
a white lace cap

children.name: helmet
children.definition: a strong hard hat that soldiers, motorcycle riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads: mũ bảo hiểm, mũ bảo hộ
examples: a cycle helmet
crash helmeta hard hat that covers and protects the whole head, worn especially by motorcyclists
pith helmet/ topeea large, hard, white hat worn to give protection from the sun. It was worn in the past by Europeans who were in hot countries : mũ bấc
cycle helmet/ cycling helmeta hard hat which you wear on your head to protect it if you have an accident while you are riding a bicycle
helmeted[adj] wearing a helmetcó đội mũ bảo hộ
Helmeted, baton-wielding police forced back the crowd.

children.name: hood
children.definition: a part of a coat, jacket etc that you can pull up to cover your head : : mũ trùm đầu
examples: The coat has a detachable hood.
Why don’t youputyourhood upif you’re cold?
hooded[adj] having a hoodcó mũ trùm đầu
a hooded jacket
armed and hooded intruders

children.name: headscarf
children.definition: a square piece of material worn on the head by women, often folded into a triangle and tied under the chin :khăn trùm đầu
examples: a silk headscarf

children.name: headband
children.definition: a band that you wear around your head to keep your hair off your face or as a decoration :băng buộc quanh trán

children.name: crown
children.definition: vương miện
examples: a)a circle made of gold and decorated with jewels, worn by kings and queens on their heads
b)a circle, sometimes made of things such as leaves or flowers, worn by someone who has won a special honour

children.name: tiara
children.definition: a piece of jewellery like a small crown , that a woman sometimes wears on very formal or important occasions : mũ miện
examples: a diamond tiara

children.name: veil
children.definition: a thin piece of material that women wear to cover their faces at formal occasions or for religious reasons: mạng che mặt
examples: She lifted her veil with both hands.
a bridal veil.
After the ceremony, the brideliftedup her veil to kiss her husband.
The women wore black veils which covered all but their eyes.

children.name: mask
children.definition: 1sth that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it : mặt nạ,
examples: agasmask
a surgicalmaskkhẩu trang y tế
asurgical face mask
a gauze maskkhẩu trang
The bank robbers wore masks throughout the raid.
He was attacked and robbed by two peoplewearing masks.
stocking mask[C] a stocking which thieves pull over their heads to hide their faces:vớ trùm đầu(cướp)
2sth that covers your face, and has another face painted on it, which is used for ceremonies or special occasions : mặt nạ
a Halloween mask

children.name: respirator
children.definition: a device worn over the mouth and nose to prevent harmful substances from being breathed in: mặt nạ phòng hơi độc:khẩu trang
examples: The firefighters wore respirators to help them breathe in the smoke-filled house.

children.name: stole
children.definition: specialized a long narrow piece of cloth, especially silk, which is worn over the shoulders by some priests in the Christian Church during religious ceremonies :khăn choàng(linh mục, phó tế)
examples: The pastors officiating at the funeral wore their purple stoles.
Along the back of the DBS were liturgical stoles, pulpit gowns, and choir robes.

children.name: cravat
children.definition: a short, wide strip of fabric worn by men round the neck and tucked inside an open-necked shirt:cái ca-vát(trong cổ)
examples: He wore a rich brick-red winter coat over a Persil-white shirt and cravat.

children.name: scarf
children.definition: a piece of cloth that you wear around your neck, head, or shoulders, especially to keep warm: khăn quàng cổ
examples: a knitted/ woollen/ silk scarf

children.name: tie
children.definition: / necktieUSC2 a long thin piece of material that is worn under a shirt collar, especially by men, and tied in a knot at the front
examples: He always wears a jacket and tie to work.
I wear a shirt and tie at work.

children.name: bow tie
children.definition: a special type of tie (= a strip of cloth put around a collar) in the shape of a bow , worn especially by men on formal occasions :nơ (dùng cho nam)

children.name: neckerchief
children.definition: a square piece of cloth that is folded and worn tied around the neck :khăn quàng nhỏ

children.name: millinery
children.definition: formal
examples: 1women's hats
her designer millinery
2the trade or business of a milliner
she is contemplating a new career in millinery

children.name: headdress
children.definition: sth that someone wears on their head, especially for decoration on a special occasion : đồ trang trí trên đầu
examples: The bride wore white with a pearl headdress.

children.name: headgear
children.definition: a hat or other covering that is worn on the head :mũ,khăn trùm đầu
examples: When riding a bicycle, you should wear the proper headgear.

children.name: brim
children.definition: the bottom part of a hat that sticks out all round :vành (mũ)
examples: a soft hat with a turned-up brim
-brimmedsuffix
She wore awide-brimmed hat.

children.name: chinstrap
children.definition: a strap that goes around the lower part of a person's head to keep a protective hat, especially a helmet, in place :quai
examples: After a while she noticed his reflected look and looked back, chewing on the leather chinstrap.

children.name: visor
children.definition: the part of a helmet (= protective hard hat) that can be lowered to protect your face : kính

children.name: peak
children.definition: mainlyUKvisorUS  the flat curved part of a cap which goes above the eyes of the person who is wearing it:lưỡi trai
examples: peaked[adj] describes a hat with a peak at the frontcó lưỡi trai
a peaked cap

children.name: pompom
children.definition: a small ball of wool or other material used as a decoration, especially on the top of a hat :ngù len (quả cầu nhỏ bằng len)

children.name: plume
children.definition: a large feather or bunch of feathers, especially one that is used as a decoration on a hatlông vũ
examples: a hat with a jaunty ostrich plume
plumed[attri]có lông vũ
The dancers wore plumed headdresses (= with a decoration which looked like several large feathers tied together) .

children.name: hatband
children.definition: a strip of material which is fixed around the outside of a hat :băng mũ

children.name: earflaps
children.definition: the two pieces of material or fur on some hats which can be pulled down to cover the ears : mũ che tai

children.name: earmuffs
children.definition: a pair of small pieces of material like fur worn over the ears with a strap that goes over the head to keep them on :mũ len che cho tai khỏi rét

children.name: balaclava
children.definition: a closely fitting covering for the head and neck, usually made from wool:mũ len trùm đầu và cổ

children.name: deerstalker
children.definition: a soft hat with two peaks (= flat curved parts that stick out), one at the back and one at the front, and coverings for the ears, which are usually worn turned up:mũ thợ săn
examples: Sherlock Holmes's deerstalker

children.name: fedora
children.definition: a man's hat, like a trilby but with a wider brim :mũ phớt mềm

children.name: mortarboard
children.definition: a black cap with a flat square top worn by members of some universities on formal occasions:mũ vuôngtốt nghiệp

children.name: sou'wester
children.definition: a waterproof hat with a wide piece at the back toprotect the neck, worn especially by sailors :

children.name: beret
children.definition: a round flat hat made of soft material :mũ nồi,nón bê-rê

children.name: turban
children.definition: head covering for a man, worn especially by Sikhs, Muslims and Hindus, and made from a long piece of cloth which is wrapped around the top of the head many times : khăn xếp
examples: Local men wore turbans, and shalwar kameez with wool vests or sweaters.
turbaned[adj]
a turbaned man
bearded and turbaned Sikhs

children.name: bearskin
children.definition: a tall black fur hat which is worn by particular soldiers, especially for formal ceremonies:nón của kỵ binh Anh

children.name: fez
children.definition: a round red hat with a flat top and no brim, especially worn in the past by men in some Muslim countries :mũ đuôi seo (người Thổ Nhĩ Kỳ)

children.name: yarmulke
children.definition: a small, circular cover for the head worn by Jewish men, especially at religious ceremonies:mũ chỏm của đàn ông Do Thái

children.name: sombrero
children.definition: a hat with a wide brim , worn especially by men in Mexico:mũ rơm rộng vành của đàn ông Mê-hi-cô

children.name: miter
children.definition: / mitreUS  a tall pointed hat worn by bishops in official ceremonies :mũ tế (của giám mục)
